channel.title: Rstudio on Dr. Erin Buchanan
channel.description: Recent content in Rstudio on Dr. Erin Buchanan

item.title: Working With Messy Text
item.author: buchananlab@gmail.com (aggieerin.com)
item.description: Heyo! I am doing my best to procrastinate here on a blustery Tuesday afternoon. So, I decided to share some code I’ve put together that solves problems in R that I used to do in perl. HTML or C++ was probably my first real language, but I love the heck out of perl. It’s never done me wrong (unlike you PHP). Anyways! The context of this project is that we are developing a dictionary of words to complement the work done by Jonathan Haidt and Jesse Graham - learn more.

item.title: New Publication - Detect Low Quality Data
item.author: buchananlab@gmail.com (aggieerin.com)
item.description: My coauthor John Scofield and I just had a publication accepted at Behavior Research Methods - you can check out the publication preprint at OSF. We thew together a website for the paper that summarizes everything we found, as well as puts all the materials together in one place - check it out. We create a really nice R function to help you detect low quality data, which you can find on GitHub, and I even made a video that explains all the parts to the function at YouTube.
